intro: Schizoglossum davyi, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in fine hairs. Schizoglossum davyi thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, mountainous environments.
